intro: Campanula pusilla var. foudrasii, commonly known as the dwarf bellflower, is a compact, low-growing plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often appearing in clusters during the summer months. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its compact form. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and ornamental plant suitable for a variety of garden environments.
